node.title: How farms have become an oasis for campers looking to escape
node.alt: Smiling women stands in front of flooded campsite with blue 'campsite 4' sign
node.description: As pandemic-weary travellers leave cities in droves, searching for serenity and space in the bush, farmers are signing up as hosts for an extra source of income.
node.content:
["As pandemic-weary campers leave cities in droves, searching for\u00a0serenity and space in the bush, farmers are signing up as hosts for an extra source of income.", "In the grips of a terrible drought that forced them to sell 40 prime milkers to the meatworks, dairy farmer Libby Rough listed with Youcamp to help pay for groceries and school costs.", "\"We didn't get a milk cheque for three months and friends had come and said, 'You should put this [farm]\u00a0on a booking system',\" Ms Rough said.", "They opened Hidden Pocket, named for its private position on the Mary River at Moy Pocket near Kenilworth in the Sunshine Coast hinterland.", "", "
Hidden Pocket is on a working dairy farm.(Supplied: Libby Rough)
", "Just four camping sites have helped turn the farm's fortunes around, earning the family more than $50,000 since American-owned Hipcamp bought out Youcamp in August 2020.", "Hidden Pocket is booked out months in advance\u00a0and has twice been nominated for awards.", "\"We pride ourselves on having a campground where thousands of people are not camping on top of each other,\" Ms Rough said.", "", "
The Roughs provide wood and fire pits at Hidden Pocket.(ABC Rural: Jennifer Nichols)
", "\"We provide fire pits, we provide kayaks \u2014 although I did lose six in the floods \u2014 we also provide tyre tubes and so people come here, and they get to relax.", "
What is Hipcamp?
", "Since 2019 the number of people using the camping platform has increased by 450 per cent.", "\"Hipcamp is essentially a marketplace where we connect landowners, farmers, and their land with people who really want an outdoor experience ...\u00a0campers, glampers, caravan people,\" Hipcamp general manager James Ho said.", "", "
Rain and income from camping have helped the dairy farm recover from drought.(ABC Rural: Jennifer Nichols)
", "\"Ironically, for us, I think we've overall been a net beneficiary of the pandemic; our user base has almost tripled in the last 12 months alone.", "\"In fact, we've seen this past summer, our biggest summer holiday on the record. Our host base has more than doubled in the last 12 months as well.\"", "", "
Money earned from camping stays has paid for farm infrastructure.(ABC Rural: Jennifer Nichols)
", "
Crucial infrastructure
", "For the Rough family, the money has paid for infrastructure that they otherwise could not have afforded, including farm fencing and fixing the road that milk tankers use to access their dairy.", "\"Those kind of jobs are really essential to our business because you can't have a milk truck driver saying I'm not coming in because the road's not good enough,\" Ms Rough said.", "", "
Hipcamp often requires campers to be self-reliant.(ABC Rural: Jennifer Nichols)
", "When a group of guests, who are required to be fully contained, used the bush as a toilet \u2014 Hipcamp followed up on her complaint and charged the campers $300 for the clean-up.", "An unexpected bonus has been the friendships they have made with return visitors.", "\"It's been a really, really good thing because we don't get a social life and sometimes Pete will come down and talk to them as well. He says he's not into it, he says [that]\u00a0it's my thing \u2014 but I've caught him talking to people. Anyone who wants to talk about cows,\" she said.", "", "
The old Queenslander required sensitive renovation.(Supplied: Lacey's Creek Homestead and Vineyard)
", "
Room to grow
", "The Queensland Farmers'\u00a0Federation (QFF) has released a discussion paper titled Unlocking Queensland's agritourism potential.", "It estimated agritourism could be worth up to $4.5 billion a year to the state by 2030\u00a0but found the lack of consistent local government planning guidelines were a barrier to farmers wanting to diversify their businesses.", "", "
Jessica Cunningham with son Jack at her homestead.(Supplied: Lacey's Creek Homestead and Vineyard)
", "It took paramedic Jessica Cunningham and her husband Ryan, a full-time engineer, six months to navigate the red tape required to begin $70,000 worth of\u00a0renovations on a century-old Queenslander they now lease on Airbnb.", "\"But once you sort of start getting into the council side of things and trying to find out the answers to certain questions, it can be a bit of a bit of a process.\"", "Lacey's Creek Homestead and Vineyard has helped make their small grazing property in the foothills of the Great Dividing Range pay for itself.", "", "
The Cunninghams retained the old Queenslander's rustic charm.(Supplied: Lacey's Creek Homestead and Vineyard)
", "\"It has been absolutely essential. Obviously, the industry's changed over the last 100 years and small farms like ours are really no longer viable on their own,\" Mr Cunningham said.", "In an age where fewer city dwellers have country cousins, the connections agritourism builds are important.", "\"For those who are interested, both my wife and I take great pleasure in showing people around the farm and taking them out to the cows,\" Mr Cunningham said.", "\"Showing them the fireflies down by the creek and taking them up to some of the really nice lookouts, we try and tailor the experience to what our guests are after.\""]
